Frank-S
What do the guys use that make the minibox's? There has got to be s=
ome
kind of
tuner that would work well and is very available.....Less noisy=
 would
definately be a plus.
I am so excited that there will be cheap FBs  =
SOON.... You just made my
day.
Are the cheap FBs going to debut at the Quee=
n Mary in Sept?
I will have to sign up........ Who knows, you might even ge=
t to slap
somebody.
Wouldn't want to miss that...... LOL
 

_______________=
_________________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com] On Behalf
Of Frank Sumption
Sent: Tuesday, April 28, 2009 9:15 PM
To=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: From April 23rd.





=
 There should be cheap FBs available soon, if the rumors I hear are
correct=
.  I have printed circuit boards made, but the troubel is---no
tuner! I don=
't want to have to rely on the Radio Shack models--that they
discontinued, =
and so far home made tuners are just too noisy(staticy).
 
 In the mean tim=
e, like Margaret said, many of the oterh method work as
well, and sometimes=
 better. There's also EVPmaker.
 
 Frank-S


On Tue, Apr 28, 2009 at 4:28 P=
M, itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...
<mailto:ITCdeadpeople@...> > wr=
ote:




	Hi Susan. I don't know what kind of box you'll end up with, but
i=
n the meantime, you can always do "manual radio sweep." I get some of
my be=
st results that way. When I started doing sweep for EVP,
commercially avail=
able boxes were not available. My favorite unit so far
is the Duracell KP02=
8 crank flashlight/radio. It might be listed as the
"3 in 1" or something l=
ike that. The knob is just the right size and
tightness to make it easy to =
sweep from one end to the other. Of course,
it's a little obnoxious to have=
 to stop and crank it up every few
minutes, but I think the results make it=
 well worth the effort. I've
seen others have good success with all kinds o=
f different radios though.
So many makes/models can work well.
	
	I own the=
 Paranormal Systems units and many of the Radio Shack
hacks, and by compari=
son, this little $20 model really holds it's own.
PLUS it would be handy in=
 case of power outage. I think it's always
great to have items around the h=
ouse that can fulfill more than one
purpose. And so budget friendly too. ;-=
)
	
	Just a thought.....
	
	Margaret 


	--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
<ma=
ilto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> , "kytten" <kytten_karmicheal@...>
wrote:
	=
>
	> Hi frank, I am new to your ground and I was curious where if
you have =
a site where you sell the boxes that you make personally.. I
know that I ca=
n I buy one of the standard boxes in various places or I
could make one my =
self... if only I was suave enough to be able to
fallow the directions.. un=
fortunately I have never really been a
direction type of person.
	> I have =
always been extra sensitive and very interested in EVP
and the paranormal e=
very since I was very little and when I heard of
your boxes recently I beca=
me very excited and would love to buy one, can
you point me in the right di=
rection..
	> Thank you, Susan
	>
